org.javasimon.jdbc4.jmx

Class JdbcMXBeanImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.javasimon.jdbc4.jmx.JdbcMXBeanImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JdbcMXBean

    public class JdbcMXBeanImpl
extends Object
implements JdbcMXBean
    Jdbc MXBean implementation. See JdbcMXBean for interface documentation. Most methods are implemented by calling the Manager.
    Since:
    2
    Author:
    Radovan Sninsky, Richard "Virgo" Richter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JdbcMXBeanImpl(Manager manager)
      MXBean constructor with prefix initialization to default (org.javasimon.jdbc).
      JdbcMXBeanImpl(Manager manager, String prefix)
      MXBean constructor with custom prefix initialization.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JdbcObjectInfo connectionsStat()
      Retrieves summary data about JDBC connection objects.
      void disableMonitoring()
      Disables monitoring (gathering statistics) by associated JDBC Simon hierarchy, see (org.javasimon.jdbc).
      void enableMonitoring()
      Enables monitoring (gathering statistics) by associated JDBC Simon hierarchy, see (org.javasimon.jdbc).
      String getPrefix()
      Returns actual prefix associated with mxbean.
      String[] getSqlCommands()
      Returns SQL command types (select, insert, delete, etc).
      StopwatchSample getSqlCommandStat(String cmdId)
      Retrieves summary data about all executed SQL commands of eneterd type (for instance summary data of all executed selects).
      String[] getSqls(String cmdId)
      Returns hashs of different SQL commands of one type (select, insert, delete, etc).
      StopwatchSample getSqlStat(String sqlId)
      Retrieves summary data about all same executed SQLs (for instance summary data of all executed select * from foo where bar => 0).
      boolean isMonitoringEnabled()
      Returns state of monitoring JDBC driver.
      JdbcObjectInfo resultsetsStat()
      Retrieves summary data about JDBC result set objects.
      void setPrefix(String value)
      Sets custom prefix of JDBC Simon hierarchy, see more JdbcMXBean.
      JdbcObjectInfo statementsStat()
      Retrieves summary data about JDBC statement objects.

      • enableMonitoring

        public void enableMonitoring()
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Enables monitoring (gathering statistics) by associated JDBC Simon hierarchy, see (org.javasimon.jdbc). Works if SimonManager is enabled, look SimonManager.isEnabled().
        Specified by:
        enableMonitoring in interface JdbcMXBean

      • disableMonitoring

        public void disableMonitoring()
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Disables monitoring (gathering statistics) by associated JDBC Simon hierarchy, see (org.javasimon.jdbc). If SimonManager is already disabled has no effect, look SimonManager.disable().
        Specified by:
        disableMonitoring in interface JdbcMXBean

      • isMonitoringEnabled

        public boolean isMonitoringEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Returns state of monitoring JDBC driver.
        Specified by:
        isMonitoringEnabled in interface JdbcMXBean
        Returns:
        true if associated prefix is enabled; otherwise false

      • getSqlCommands

        public String[] getSqlCommands()
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Returns SQL command types (select, insert, delete, etc). If client application uses DDL commands like create, alter and other, those are included too. Special case are batch-es, they are referenced as batch.
        Specified by:
        getSqlCommands in interface JdbcMXBean
        Returns:
        list of string (references to used SQL command types in monitored (simoned) application)
        See Also:
        JdbcMXBean.getSqlCommandStat(String), JdbcMXBean.getSqls(String)

      • getSqlCommandStat

        public StopwatchSample getSqlCommandStat(String cmdId)
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Retrieves summary data about all executed SQL commands of eneterd type (for instance summary data of all executed selects).
        Specified by:
        getSqlCommandStat in interface JdbcMXBean
        Parameters:
        cmdId - SQL command type
        Returns:
        populated object StopwatchSample, or null if entered sql command type has no associated javasimon (it means, no sql of this type was executed yet, for instance no update was executed yet)
        See Also:
        JdbcMXBean.connectionsStat()

      • getSqls

        public String[] getSqls(String cmdId)
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Returns hashs of different SQL commands of one type (select, insert, delete, etc). Each hash represent one sql command with (and its many executions).
        Specified by:
        getSqls in interface JdbcMXBean
        Parameters:
        cmdId - cmd SQL command type (select, insert, delete, etc)
        Returns:
        list of string (hash references to used SQL command in monitored (simoned) application)
        See Also:
        JdbcMXBean.getSqlCommands(), JdbcMXBean.getSqlStat(String)

      • getSqlStat

        public StopwatchSample getSqlStat(String sqlId)
        Description copied from interface: JdbcMXBean
        Retrieves summary data about all same executed SQLs (for instance summary data of all executed select * from foo where bar => 0).
        Specified by:
        getSqlStat in interface JdbcMXBean
        Parameters:
        sqlId - hash code of sql command
        Returns:
        populated object StopwatchSample, or null if entered sql has no associated javasimon (it means, no sql like this was executed yet, for instance no update was executed yet)
        See Also:
        JdbcMXBean.getSqls(String)
